Strikerace100, why do you say "Do Not Download"?  The Cinavia protection is an audio watermark embedded into the original Blu-Ray disc; it's nothing that can harm your computer or anything else, it's certainly not something added or deliberately included by HolyRoses (there probably aren't any copies of this movie without that watermarking), and only affects people who buy a Blu-Ray player which is crippled with protection crap.

Possible solutions?  Downgrade your PS3 firmware to v3.01 or v3.00, or watch the movie on your computer, or set up a HTPC (costs nothing if you have an old PC kicking around, and can be superior in some ways to a PS3 for this purpose), or just suck it up and quit whinging on quality torrents...  Actually, definitely do that last part - HR only puts out the best rips, and doesn't need your garbage comments muddying up the legitimate feedback.

Love your work HR, my gf and I really appreciate your efforts, especially all the great iPod format releases :)
